content.description: Sit start on the shield feature in the center of the boulder., Head right to a large horizontal shelf feature and then up and top it out.
content.location: Boulder 15 yards south of the Fred and Uncle boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the lowest part of diagonal crimp slot. Follow the crimp rail for a hold or two and then head up and left to the lip.
content.location: Left side of boulder 15 yards south of the Fred and Uncle Boulder.

content.description: Amazing crimp line on great rock. To the right of Fred. Climbs to the highest point of the boulder.
content.location: When facing King Crimson & Iron Butterfly, walk left and down a steep hill 20 yards to the boulder with Uncle & Fred.

content.description: Fun lowball roof that is worth doing if your visiting this area.
content.location: Right on the trail as you exit the drainage just off the road.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the vertical tufa tube where the rock changes from black to tan. Head up and right, following the prominent feature. top out direct and slightly left once you reach the good holds at the end.
content.protection: Pads, landing is angled but fine with a few
content.location: Obvious boulder immediately behind Innagada Davita. When facing Inna Gadda Da Vida, walk around left & up 10 yards and then down & left 10 yards to reach King Crimson and Iron Butterfly.

content.description: Start on King Crimson but instead of following the tufa to the right, do a big move straight up to a small pocket. Finish straight up as the blank face turns to slab.
content.location: Obvious boulder immediately behind Innagada Davita.Â When facing Inna Gadda Da Vida, walk around left & up 10 yards and then down & left 10 yards to reach King Crimson and Iron Butterfly.

content.description: Start low on jugs and proceed up to slopers. Excellent rock quality throughout, though careful tuggin on the slab.
content.location: Per BH: There is an obvious big arete on the up hill side of the road. About 100ft left of the arete is a little black roof Davita put up called Oblivious v5. Walk up the easier but steep wash to Oblivious from there head up canyon out of the boulders then strait up hill a 100yds. It sits on high ground between the washes. You can see the top of the boulder from the road.

content.description: Cool crimps lead to a fun lip encounter on more cool crimps. A good warm up for the area.
content.location:
Left of Uncle.

When facing King Crimson & Iron Butterfly, walk left and down a steep hill 20 yards to the boulder with Uncle & Fred.
